name: Hoy Lai Pad Nam Prik Pow (Clams with Chili Paste and Basil)
author: Toi
summary: Clams prepared this way always garner standing ovations from my guests. Little do they know that it is a very fast and uncomplicated dish to prepare. For that reason--and of course for its delicious taste--I love making this dish.
ingredients: 3 tablespoons Nam Prik Pao (roasted chile paste)
1 cup Bai Kraprao (holy basil leaves), or to taste
directions: Heat a large heavy-bottomed pan or wok over high heat; add the oil and wait 1 minute more
Mix garlic into the hot oil and cook until it just turns golden brown, about 1 minute
Add clams and chile paste; stir until clams are coated
Stir fish sauce, chiles, and sugar into clams; cook and stir until the clams have opened, 5 to 10 minutes
Mix basil into clam mixture and cook until wilted, about 1 minute
